result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Micah A Minor

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Defendant, Micah A Minor with Attorney George E. Miller appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Diane Wood Webster.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(2:14)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
Miller - have agreement - plea to OWI 15TR5427 lowest level guideline $811.50 no blood draw 6 mo revo AODA, no IID, refusal requires one year IID - he's already been revoked so gets credit - refusal remains in effect - requests half price
Miller - 15CM467 - plea to Ct 1, 12 mo prob with 20 days jail stayed & imposed 4 days credit
16CF28 plea to Ct 1 - w/held 2 yrs prob 30 days jail conditional stayed 180 hrs comm serv, no alcohol, no para, full time work school, comply with all rules, credit 69 days if revoked - all other cases dismissed - and have to waive prelim

Deft - 16CF28 - waives prelim
State files Information***
Deft - 15CM467 - Ct 1 pleads no contest - waives rights & jt
          16CF28 Ct 1 - pleads no contest - waives rights & jt
          15TR5427 pleads no contest

w/held sentence 1 yr probation
20 days jail imposed and stayed
credit 4 days if revoked

no possession or consumption alcohol/drugs without prescription and no paraphenalia

credit 69 days if revoked

COURT:  would make since to administratively transfer 16CF28 to Branch 2 - take off Br 1 date and set July 19th date
